llm.feedback: The draft is factually sound but exceeds the 4–6‑sentence limit, mixes explanatory detail with the core view, and never explicitly ties the mortgage rate to a canonical handle (UST 10‑year).  Condense it to 5 concise sentences that: 1) state the current 30‑yr rate and its derivation from the UST 10‑year yield + ~0.5 % spread (LF0UUL917); 2) give a clear range for the rate under a September Fed cut (6.45–6.50 %) versus no cut or a dollar slide (6.60–6.70 %) with citations (Z7O1DCHS7, 97MD1FHW8); 3) note that sticky inflation (CPI 2.7 %, PCE 2.9 %) keeps the cut contingent on labor‑market signals, with a PCE < 2.5 % or weak NFP triggering a cut, otherwise inflation > 2.5 % supports the high‑rate stance (FAN5RYW6T, XTQIQRP5K); 4) highlight Treasury debt‑issuance and loan‑originating demand as catalysts that could widen the spread (LF0UUL917); 5) list watch items (Fed decision 16‑17 Sep, PCE 15 Sep, NFP 30 Sep, debt‑issuance announcements) and state a 60–70 % confidence that a September cut will materialize conditional on inflation > 2.5 % (XTQIQRP5K, FAN5RYW6T).  Ensure each claim carries an inline citation and that the text remains strictly about the mortgage rate, mapping it to the UST 10‑year handle.
